results:
I found comprehensive information about film adaptations of "The Picture of Dorian Gray," including the specific films you mentioned. Here's what I discovered:

## 1945 Adaptation
The 1945 version was directed by Albert Lewin and starred George Sanders as Henry Wotton and Hurd Hatfield as Dorian Gray. Angela Lansbury was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for her role as Sibyl Vane. The BBC in 2000 declared it "Among the many film adaptations of Oscar Wilde's 'The Picture of Dorian Gray', this 1945 MGM version is without a doubt the best".

## 2009 Adaptation
Ben Barnes and Colin Firth starred in the 2009 film "Dorian Gray", which was directed by Oliver Parker, and the screenplay was written by Toby Finlay. The film also starred Rebecca Hall, Ben Chaplin, Emilia Fox, and Rachel Hurd-Wood.

## Modern Adaptations
Several modern adaptations are mentioned:

- Netflix is in the process of adapting "The Picture of Dorian Gray" into a modern TV series, titled "The Grays," produced by Berlanti Productions and Warner Bros. Television
- The series will center on siblings Basil and Dorian Gray as "The Grays" tackles the classic's themes through the eyes of the modern beauty industry
- A recent adaptation "Adapts Dorian as a modern social media influencer in an online world fixated by selfies and streaming"(no content)Over thirty adaptations of Oscar Wilde's The Picture of Dorian Gray have made it to the screen, starting in the earliest days of moving pictures, demonstrating the enduring appeal of this classic story across different eras and interpretations.
